terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs
Class AccelerateInputDragFilter

java.lang.Object
  terrapeer.vui.j3dui.control.inputs.AccelerateInputDragFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputCancelTarget, InputDragTarget
public class AccelerateInputDragFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements InputDragTarget, InputCancelTarget

An input drag filter that interprets an input drag as an acceleration of output change, with the new rate of change maintained between drags. Use InputCancelTarget to reset the filter (i.e. zero rate of change). This filter should only be used with sensors monitoring the same display canvas otherwise its operation is undefined. Also, downstream mappers must be set for cumulative dragging to realize sustained movement of the target object.

Unlike other input drag filters, an input drag to this filter does not produce a direct output drag. Instead, the input drag controls the acceleration of the output position (rate of the rate of change), with the resulting output velocity (rate of change) being maintained between input drags. Also, each output position update is implemented as a separate drag rather than as a single continuous drag (which is why cumulative dragging must be enabled for continuous movement). This is to assure that intuitive mappers correctly reference the current state of any source reference nodes controlled by this filter, such as the view itself for DRM. The reason is that actuators, such as those controlling the source nodes, work relative to a reference actuation state typically established at the start of a drag.

Because of the indirect and accumulative nature of the output change, typically limits are needed on the output rate, which can be set using setRateClamp().

toOutputRate

protected double toOutputRate(double pos,
                              double gamma)
Computes the output target rate value given the input source input position value according to a rate curve that is a gamma function of the form:

outval = sgn(inval) * (abs(inval)**(1/gamma))

If gamma is less than 1 then the curve is exponential. If it is greater than 1 then it is logarithmic.

Override to change the transfer function.

Parameters:
pos - Input source position.
gamma - Rate curve gamma factor. Greater than 0.
Returns:
Output target rate.

setTargetDelta

protected void setTargetDelta(double deltaX,
                              double deltaY)
Always use this method to set the target delta so that it will be clamped.
